sections.title: Landlord Entry Requirements
sections.text: In Boston, landlords must provide reasonable notice before entering a rental unit, typically 24-48 hours. Entry must be for a legitimate purpose and at reasonable times. Entry without notice may violate tenant privacy rights under Massachusetts law.

sections.title: Security Deposit Requirements
sections.text: In Boston, security deposits are limited to one month's rent. All deposits must be held in a separate interest-bearing escrow account. Landlords must return deposits within 30 days with itemized deductions. Deposits cannot be 'non-refundable' or subject to landlord's unilateral discretion.

sections.title: Warranty of Habitability
sections.text: Landlords must maintain rental units in habitable condition with working heat (minimum 68Â°F from September to June), hot water, plumbing, and compliance with State Sanitary Code. Tenants may withhold rent or file complaints with Inspectional Services if landlords fail to make necessary repairs.
